title: ‘Every single cage is full’: Nearly 100 cats rescued from Rhode Island hoarding situation
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Ninety-seven cats were rescued from a 1200-square-foot apartment in Woonsocket, Rhode Island by the RISPCA.
Some cats are pregnant; others have colds and require medical treatment and behavioral assessments, the RISPCA said.
The shelter seeks donations for supplies and treatment costs via Venmo, PayPal, or their item wishlist.

title: What Jarren Duran said of trade rumors, reps at DH with Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jarren Duran may see more time as a designated hitter due to Red Sox's outfield surplus in 2026.
Duran, 29, expressed flexibility about his role and hasn't been officially approached about moving to DH.
Duran was involved in trade rumors, but he is unfazed, joking about his parents' concern over such reports.

title: Bruins’ Jordan Harris looking to make hockey more accessible, inclusive in Mass.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins' Jordan Harris launched Harris' Huskies to promote youth hockey accessibility with SCORE Boston, a nonprofit aiding underserved children.
Harris' program includes clinics, equipment, and transportation, helping kids overcome hockey's barriers with support from NHL and Bruins Foundation.
Despite injury setbacks, Harris is committed to growing hockey in Massachusetts and aiding the Bruins' playoff push this season.

title: When will Jayson Tatum return for Celtics? Bill Simmons makes his prediction.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum's potential return for the Celtics is speculated to be around March 1, according to Bill Simmons.
NBC released a trailer for a docuseries on Tatum's return, hinting at his possible comeback during upcoming NBA games.
Tatum has been participating in practices and progressing in rehab after his Achilles injury last May.

title: State Police trooper seriously injured after cruiser hit on North Shore highway
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A State Police trooper was seriously injured after a vehicle struck his cruiser on I-95 in Salisbury.
The trooper was hospitalized but has since been released to recover at home, according to State Police.
Driver Josue Levi Cuevas Santana faces charges for negligent operation, speeding, and using a mobile device while driving.

title: Fleet goalie Aerin Frankel sets Olympic record, helps Team USA advance to gold-medal game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Aerin Frankel made history with three shutouts in the 2026 Winter Olympics, leading Team USA to the final.
Frankel stopped 21 shots in a 5-0 win against Sweden, helping USA secure a place in the gold-medal game.
Team USA, with Frankel's .985 save percentage, faces Canada next, aiming for their first Olympic gold since 2018.

title: Woman found dead, search for husband suspended after couple falls through ice in Eastham, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A couple fell through ice at Bee's River in Eastham on Feb. 14 while walking their dog, officials said.
The woman was found dead after rescue crews searched First Encounter Beach; her husband remains missing.
Search for the missing man was suspended due to ice conditions, pending changes for safe access, police stated.

title: ‘Just pick up a glove’: Tom Werner was disappointed in Rafael Devers saga
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Tom Werner criticized Rafael Devers for refusing to play first base when needed, leading to his trade to the Giants.
Rafael Devers was traded in 2025 after conflicts over his position following Red Sox's signing of Alex Bregman.
Red Sox president Sam Kennedy admitted possible mishandling of Devers situation, acknowledging it as a difficult decision.

title: What Sam Kennedy said about Bregman, Devers, and ‘hurtful’ narrative about Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Sam Kennedy addressed concerns about Red Sox's commitment to winning and emphasized the importance of future performance.
Rafael Devers was traded after disputes over his position, while Alex Bregman left for the Cubs due to contract issues.
The Red Sox have the MLB's seventh-highest payroll at $256.1 million, indicating ownership's investment in team success.

title: 3 dead, 3 injured in shooting at R.I. high school hockey game, mayor calls shooting ‘targeted family dispute’
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Three people, including the shooter, were killed at Lynch Arena during a Pawtucket high school hockey game.
The shooting, which injured three others, was described by the mayor as a 'targeted family dispute.'
The shooter, identified as Robert Dorgan, died from an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound, police said.
